title: Isis in Darkness - unable to imagine

content.question: In the context of the passage as a whole, which of the following best explains why Richard is unable to imagine Selena at their high school in the eighth paragraph (“She and . . . school’s”)?

choices.label: He thinks that her unusual poise would have alienated her from other students.
He views her as too exceptional for such a common setting.
He suspects that she would have given up poetry for less creative pursuits.
He believes that her intellectual curiosity would not have been satisfied there.

content.answer: He views her as too exceptional for such a common setting.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain the function of contrasts within a text.
